commit_message:
Use new oslo.config api to generate configuration-group help

oslo.config recently updated its api to allow discovery of
help attached to configuration groups [1][2]. This patch
changes the list_opts function to use the new api and allow
for automatic generation of help on configuration groups.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.config/+bug/1395819
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242472/

Depends-On: I3cbdaa7e5dfb75d4c9eb687e68d3a35e61550d1b
Change-Id: I8eabf52236bf571d42d3021f2485c1898cddd31a

subject: Always use constraints
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-24 14:15:54.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Always use constraints

This flips the tox.ini to always use constraints installation for all
targets. It drops the extra -constraints targets in the process. This
makes it so there is no developer change required to operate in our new
world order.

Note that coverage and release-notes jobs cannot use constraints yet to
limitations of the tools we use. So, they continue to use the normal
non-constraint install.

Change-Id: I218f16c585b7b8a9ea73c6cf1c5b0aef2dcde015
Depends-On: Ia08c15914d9dbfc3f5dc04ca69a7be26efb6fe64
'}]
commit_message:
Always use constraints

This flips the tox.ini to always use constraints installation for all
targets. It drops the extra -constraints targets in the process. This
makes it so there is no developer change required to operate in our new
world order.

Note that coverage and release-notes jobs cannot use constraints yet to
limitations of the tools we use. So, they continue to use the normal
non-constraint install.

Change-Id: I218f16c585b7b8a9ea73c6cf1c5b0aef2dcde015
Depends-On: Ia08c15914d9dbfc3f5dc04ca69a7be26efb6fe64

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-09-25 17:44:01.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/remove-volume-manager-locks.rst'], 'message': 'Remove Volume Manager Locks

The purpose of this spec is to propose a way of removing some of
the locks that are present in Cinder's volume manager.  Currently
there are four methods in the volume manager that utilize locks
to prevent a volume or snapshot from being accessed while it is
already processing an action.  The proposed change is to have
the Cinder volume API check if a volume or snapshot has an "ING"
status before even trying to go to the volume manager.  If the
volume or snapshot is already busy an exception can be returned
to the caller.  This makes the majority of the locks in Cinder
volume mananger no longer needed.

APIImpact
blueprint: remove-volume-manager-locks
Change-Id: I03172acecfceb7d037e8783f2a8bcc7e6f1646c2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Volume Manager Locks

The purpose of this spec is to propose a way of removing some of
the locks that are present in Cinder's volume manager.  Currently
there are four methods in the volume manager that utilize locks
to prevent a volume or snapshot from being accessed while it is
already processing an action.  The proposed change is to have
the Cinder volume API check if a volume or snapshot has an "ING"
status before even trying to go to the volume manager.  If the
volume or snapshot is already busy an exception can be returned
to the caller.  This makes the majority of the locks in Cinder
volume mananger no longer needed.

APIImpact
blueprint: remove-volume-manager-locks
Change-Id: I03172acecfceb7d037e8783f2a8bcc7e6f1646c2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-24 15:38:24.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/context.py'], 'message': 'Context calls super first

When subclassing a class, the subclass typically initializes the
superclass first and adds its own behavior on afterwards.

This allows the superclass to change in some ways while the
subclass continues to work.

Change-Id: I4620b925f569ce30fbb9f2d2c1838aa9b974bf3f
'}]
commit_message:
Context calls super first

When subclassing a class, the subclass typically initializes the
superclass first and adds its own behavior on afterwards.

This allows the superclass to change in some ways while the
subclass continues to work.

Change-Id: I4620b925f569ce30fbb9f2d2c1838aa9b974bf3f

commit_message:
Refactor share metadata tests to use DB

For the moment tests in 'manila.tests.api.v1.test_share_metadata' module
mock all DB requests.
It leads to failures in main code if we use DB-specific things.
So, refactor all tests in that module to use test DB to unblock usage of
DB-specific things.

Change-Id: Ia584e3e6bd02f937df7630a1d09d49c888f77c8f
Partial-Bug: #1528227
(cherry picked from commit 7319e0fe6f52c74b09fbfb4bca49ef49322ecc0e)

  Magnum client has moved out apiclient and cliutils from

subject: Return appropriate data on share create
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-16 17:16:38.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_shares.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_api.py', 'manila/share/api.py'], 'message': "Return appropriate data on share create

With the introduction of share instances in the Liberty
release, some attributes of the share model were moved
to the share_instance model. The create API has since
been returning merely the share data which makes
for a bad user experience with some attributes
being set to null.

Fix this issue by retrieving the share from the database
after the instance has been created; so that the status
field reflects the pre-scheduler acceptable status of
'creating'.

Note: Back porting this fix needs commit
7319e0fe6f52c74b09fbfb4bca49ef49322ecc0e to be back ported
as well to fix the share_metadata unit tests since they
use this API as well.

Depends-On: Ia584e3e6bd02f937df7630a1d09d49c888f77c8f
Change-Id: I63955e1a60e7ced3ad126829521cd43e0b914c17
Closes-Bug: #1534161
(cherry picked from commit 2e65c5cf356252d1647f4f232fb48e3c695d0f3d)
"}]
commit_message:
Return appropriate data on share create

With the introduction of share instances in the Liberty
release, some attributes of the share model were moved
to the share_instance model. The create API has since
been returning merely the share data which makes
for a bad user experience with some attributes
being set to null.

Fix this issue by retrieving the share from the database
after the instance has been created; so that the status
field reflects the pre-scheduler acceptable status of
'creating'.

Note: Back porting this fix needs commit
7319e0fe6f52c74b09fbfb4bca49ef49322ecc0e to be back ported
as well to fix the share_metadata unit tests since they
use this API as well.

Depends-On: Ia584e3e6bd02f937df7630a1d09d49c888f77c8f
Change-Id: I63955e1a60e7ced3ad126829521cd43e0b914c17
Closes-Bug: #1534161
(cherry picked from commit 2e65c5cf356252d1647f4f232fb48e3c695d0f3d)

commit_message:
Remove legacy patching code

In Fuel 5.1 we had an experimental feature - 'patching openstack env'.
The idea was to update and to rollback OpenStack environments between
minor releases. However, we have encounter a lot of problems with
restoring OpenStack databases andresolving dependency hell in packages,
so we buried it and never release it.

This patch removes legacy code from the source tree. We can do it
without fear, since it wasn't released in public and, moreover,
was broken since Fuel 6.0 (no chance someone use it).

Change-Id: I38625a354ea1f09efa24f3e4d18cd4337b7dcc5b
Related-Bug: #1511499

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 9410, 'name': 'Yanis Guenane', 'email': 'yguenane@redhat.com', 'username': 'yguenane'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11491, 'name': 'Gael Chamoulaud', 'email': 'gchamoul@redhat.com', 'username': 'gchamoul'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-01 20:57:28.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/loadbalancer.pp'], 'message': "loadbalancer: fix MySQL timeout HAproxy config

Current HAproxy config is broken for MySQL timeout parameters.
This is what we have today by default in HAproxy logs:
--------------
[WARNING] 238/115010 (13878) : config : missing timeouts for proxy
'mysql'.
| While not properly invalid, you will certainly encounter various
problems
| with such a configuration. To fix this, please ensure that all
following
| timeouts are set to a non-zero value: 'client', 'connect', 'server'.
--------------

This patch aims to:
* Use the correct parameters to configure puppetlabs-haproxy
* Update the database timeouts to higher values to prevent the
services from disconnecting too frequently by setting the Galera HAProxy
timeout to 90 minutes.

Change-Id: I06dd4bf81d4f4fd3c01bb681f6f0b3152f2b8eea
"}]
commit_message:
loadbalancer: fix MySQL timeout HAproxy config

Current HAproxy config is broken for MySQL timeout parameters.
This is what we have today by default in HAproxy logs:
--------------
[WARNING] 238/115010 (13878) : config : missing timeouts for proxy
'mysql'.
| While not properly invalid, you will certainly encounter various
problems
| with such a configuration. To fix this, please ensure that all
following
| timeouts are set to a non-zero value: 'client', 'connect', 'server'.
--------------

This patch aims to:
* Use the correct parameters to configure puppetlabs-haproxy
* Update the database timeouts to higher values to prevent the
services from disconnecting too frequently by setting the Galera HAProxy
timeout to 90 minutes.

Change-Id: I06dd4bf81d4f4fd3c01bb681f6f0b3152f2b8eea

commit_message:
Remove useless get_replication_updates driver call

We had the call in the manager as part of a periodic,
it did nothing at all.  Some drivers had comments "no idea
what to do with this", even better we had unit tests that
faked out a call that returned nothing and asserted it was
nothing. ?!?

Let's just remove it

Change-Id: I3c1ef6065e73d90912d7f765d581add9bc704c7b
Closes-Bug: #1547666

commit_message:
Blacklist didn't work if running VirtualBox

This commit fixes blacklist procedure if running VirtualBox because
the 'virt-what' reports several hypervisors, such as "virtualbox" and
"kvm".

Closes-Bug: #1523526

commit_message:
Add pagination support to other resources

In Liberty release, we have added pagination
to backups and snapshot as per bp:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/extend-limit-implementations.
There are still some work that hasn't been done yet.

In Mitaka, we intend to add pagination support to
CG, volume type and Qos specs.

Implements: blueprint add-pagination-to-other-resource
Change-Id: Ibd5fe91981d111c3c6a961676b829c3da4fc0c55

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-24 14:51:51.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/nova/templates/nova.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/haproxy.cfg.j2', 'ansible/roles/keystone/templates/wsgi-keystone.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/cinder/templates/cinder.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/glance/templates/glance-api.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/common/templates/heka-keystone.toml.j2'], 'message': 'Use passed client IP address in various audit logs

HAProxy: change to use option forwardfor to pass origin IP address
to backend via X-Forwarded-For header

Keystone: Apache does the audit logs for keystone.  Change the
LogFormat to display the passed address instead of the connection
address which is that of the load balancer.

Nova, Cinder, Glance: these services can make use of the address
passed in X-Forwarded-For.  With this setting the API logs for
these services include the client IP address.

Change-Id: Ia861ecc11a7c7d463d0366586926d1a842853f69
Closes-Bug: #1548935
'}]
commit_message:
Use passed client IP address in various audit logs

HAProxy: change to use option forwardfor to pass origin IP address
to backend via X-Forwarded-For header

Keystone: Apache does the audit logs for keystone.  Change the
LogFormat to display the passed address instead of the connection
address which is that of the load balancer.

Nova, Cinder, Glance: these services can make use of the address
passed in X-Forwarded-For.  With this setting the API logs for
these services include the client IP address.

Change-Id: Ia861ecc11a7c7d463d0366586926d1a842853f69
Closes-Bug: #1548935

commit_message:
Fix Node.reset_to_discover method

Setting Node's attribute `online` manually is a bad idea. It's the
asssassind area of responsibility to set this attribute. If you do it
manually you must be sure that node really offline. If you don't check
it's may be the cause of some strange bugs such as bug/1440081. This
patch changes Node.reset_to_discover method so that it leave online
attribute the same and let assasind do the work.

Change-Id: I25b2e6ae5694652cd3606cc99fa5cd8542f73005
Closes-Bug: #1440081

commit_message:
Fix trusted-host filter for pip_get_pip_options

Patch https://review.openstack.org/277905 implemented the incorrect
filter for the trusted host, resulting in the full URL being
implemented as a parameter value instead of just the host name.

This patch implements the correct filter.

Change-Id: I2f8b001717befa78d40213b1dce2399f1265c5a7

commit_message:
Verify backup integrity during backup and restore

md5sum of backup archive is now checked during backup
and verified before before restore.

Also fixes 02393e503db32ee3c790e249df11c967dfcd1af4
which accidentally forced full backups

Change-Id: Ib1ea740ed248838708a09b098cf14021014df18b
Closes-Bug: #1541539
(cherry picked from commit b8eb70d85567973b98764a4ccc4fb7140c1aef44)

commit_message:
Useless return statement in validate_sort_dir

In watcher/api/controllers/v1/utils.py, in
the validate_sort_dir method has a return statement,
however the return value is exactly the parameter's value.

This is misleading, so I removed it.

Closes-Bug: #1546917

subject: Resolve packaging problems in virtualenv(s)
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-23 18:09:42.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/repo_build/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/repo_build/tasks/repo_venv_build.yml'], 'message': "Resolve packaging problems in virtualenv(s)

Because VirtualEnv always assumes you will have the latest and
greatest versions of wheel, pip, and setuptools a couple of changes
need to be done to ensure that the virtualenv command is sourcing
the versions of our packages as we intend in all cases. Currently
our venvs are being populated by pip8 and due to several OS
incompatibilities we're causing ourselves intermitent failures
and other harm by not poperly locking this down.

The change simply forces the virtuenv command to use the release
tag source for all package installs when its preping a new venv
for a given service.

Change-Id: I773c64e2ffb397862bd42ab80a4b4657cdc4809a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve packaging problems in virtualenv(s)

Because VirtualEnv always assumes you will have the latest and
greatest versions of wheel, pip, and setuptools a couple of changes
need to be done to ensure that the virtualenv command is sourcing
the versions of our packages as we intend in all cases. Currently
our venvs are being populated by pip8 and due to several OS
incompatibilities we're causing ourselves intermitent failures
and other harm by not poperly locking this down.

The change simply forces the virtuenv command to use the release
tag source for all package installs when its preping a new venv
for a given service.

Change-Id: I773c64e2ffb397862bd42ab80a4b4657cdc4809a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Tokens need domain scope
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 19:12:01.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/identity/v3/test_tokens.py'], 'message': 'Tokens need domain scope

When calling get_token() there are many assumptions on the
domain when domain_id or domain_name is not specified.
This is okay when running tempest against devstack, since
there is a default domain but in productions there is
rarely a default domain.  Instead we should read the arguments
from the config and pass them to get_token to create a token
scoped to the user in the config.  This can be done easily
since get_token() accepts **kwargs, all we need to do is pass the
credentials and get_token with create a token specific to the user
defined in the tempest.conf.

Change-Id: I8a8dd7259820fbd4e16c65ab4eab1ae52fa5af4f
Depends-On: I74cd2fc669340d056a877f997cd74d95465494f5
'}]
commit_message:
Tokens need domain scope

When calling get_token() there are many assumptions on the
domain when domain_id or domain_name is not specified.
This is okay when running tempest against devstack, since
there is a default domain but in productions there is
rarely a default domain.  Instead we should read the arguments
from the config and pass them to get_token to create a token
scoped to the user in the config.  This can be done easily
since get_token() accepts **kwargs, all we need to do is pass the
credentials and get_token with create a token specific to the user
defined in the tempest.conf.

Change-Id: I8a8dd7259820fbd4e16c65ab4eab1ae52fa5af4f
Depends-On: I74cd2fc669340d056a877f997cd74d95465494f5

commit_message:
Switch HTTP store to using requests

Previously the HTTP store was using httplib and specifically unverified
HTTPS connections to download data about images. By switching to using
requests, we will get several benefits:

1. Certificate verification when using HTTPS
2. Connection pooling when following redirects
3. Help handling redirects

Closes-bug: 1263067
Partial-bug: 1436082
Implements: blueprint http-store-on-requests

Co-Authored-By: Sabari Kumar Murugesan <smurugesan@vmware.com>

Change-Id: Ib114919c1e1361ba64fe9e8382e1a2c39dbb3271

commit_message:
Immutable parameters

Add a new "immutable" boolean field to the parameters section in a HOT
template.  A value of True will result in the engine rejecting
stack-updates that include changes to that parameter.  When not
specified in the template, "immutable" defaults to False to ensure
backwards compatibility with old templates.

blueprint: immutable-parameters
Change-Id: If17df0b97e96ff2a1926451634e4744d6c3e26f1

commit_message:
Nova Neutron configuration now uses keystone v3 endpoint

Our current nova-neutron configuration does not work with
the latest puppet-nova. In particular, this patch[1].

This commit adds keystone v3 endpoints to the map and gets the
nova::network::neutron configuration to use them.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/d09868a59c451932d67c66101b725182d7066a14

Change-Id: Ifb8c23c81c665c2732fa5cd757760668b06a449a

[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-02-24 14:45:00.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/service.py', 'ironic/drivers/base.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/mgr_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_task_manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/test_base.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_base_manager.py', 'requirements.txt', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'doc/source/dev/architecture.rst', 'ironic/conductor/base_manager.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/inspector.py', 'releasenotes/notes/futurist-e9c55699f479f97a.yaml', 'ironic/conductor/task_manager.py'], 'message': 'Switch to Futurist library for asynchronous execution and periodic tasks

This change switches the conductor to using Futurist library executor and
periodic tasks worker instead of oslo.service periodic tasks. This allows
running periodic tasks in parallel and relying on more standard interfaces
(futures, executors) when dealing with asynchronous execution.

A green thread executor is used instead of using an eventlet green pool
directly. The maximum number of workers is taken from the existing
workers_pool_size configuration option, and no tasks are allowed
to be enqueued to mimic the previous behaviour (might be lifted later).

The periodic tasks worker is using the same executor, and its main loop thread
is also running on it. For this reason minimum value for workers_pool_size
is now 3: periodic task main loop, keep alive thread and at least one thread for
other tasks. A special decorator for driver-periodic tasks is now deprecated,
as the generic decorator can be used there as well.

Closes-Bug: #1526277
Change-Id: I57bf7cebfb6db805b6c521bacfef2993b16ce1ee
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to Futurist library for asynchronous execution and periodic tasks

This change switches the conductor to using Futurist library executor and
periodic tasks worker instead of oslo.service periodic tasks. This allows
running periodic tasks in parallel and relying on more standard interfaces
(futures, executors) when dealing with asynchronous execution.

A green thread executor is used instead of using an eventlet green pool
directly. The maximum number of workers is taken from the existing
workers_pool_size configuration option, and no tasks are allowed
to be enqueued to mimic the previous behaviour (might be lifted later).

The periodic tasks worker is using the same executor, and its main loop thread
is also running on it. For this reason minimum value for workers_pool_size
is now 3: periodic task main loop, keep alive thread and at least one thread for
other tasks. A special decorator for driver-periodic tasks is now deprecated,
as the generic decorator can be used there as well.

Closes-Bug: #1526277
Change-Id: I57bf7cebfb6db805b6c521bacfef2993b16ce1ee

commit_message:
Deployment with platform components

Acceptance tests:

Scenario is the same, component install difference only.

Add tests:
*	Deploy cluster with detached keystone, rabbitmq, database and Sahara.
*	Deploy cluster with detached keystone, rabbitmq, database and Murano.
*	Deploy cluster with detached keystone, rabbitmq, database and Ceilometer.

HUGE env (not always pass on deploy):
*	Deploy cluster with 3 controllers, 3 nodes with detached rabbitmq service and 3 nodes with detached db service.
	Note: this test requires at least 11 slaves.

Closes-Bug: #1537784
Change-Id: I243773851d980eee21372965f614d2d4a36388b6
(cherry picked from commit d70073a094da8f26ff52383fbccb4c5ab0e6bb58)

subject: Implement Option for Two VIPs to separate API traffic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1390, 'name': 'Paul Bourke', 'email': 'pauldbourke@proton.me', 'username': 'pauldbourke'}, {'_account_id': 2834, 'name': 'Steven Dake', 'email': 'steven.dake@gmail.com', 'username': 'sdake'}, {'_account_id': 9927, 'name': 'Britt Houser', 'email': 'bhouser@cisco.com', 'username': 'britthouser'}, {'_account_id': 10787, 'name': 'Michal Jastrzebski (inc0)', 'email': 'michal.jastrzebski@intel.com', 'username': 'inc0'}, {'_account_id': 11561, 'name': 'Dave McCowan', 'email': 'dmccowan@cisco.com', 'username': 'dave-mccowan'}, {'_account_id': 14119, 'name': 'Sam Yaple', 'email': 'sam+git@yaple.net', 'username': 'SamYaple'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-24 14:18:21.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/haproxy.cfg.j2', 'ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/keepalived.conf.j2', 'ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'etc/kolla/globals.yml'], 'message': 'Implement Option for Two VIPs to separate API traffic

To improve security, operators have asked for two VIPs for
their cloud.

VIP 1 is the internal VIP that can reach internal and admin endpoints.
In addition, the internal VIP can also reach other internal services,
such as the database and message services.
VIP 2 is the external VIP that can only reach public endpoints.

With one VIP only, all services are reached at the same address.

To add a second VIP, this patch adds two new configuration parameters.

kolla_external_vip_address: is an IPv4 address to use for created VIP
kolla_external_vip_interface: is the network interface to use for VIP
In this scenario, the first VIP (the internal VIP), is defined by
the original parameters (kolla_internal address and network_interface).

When using two VIPs, the existing kolla_external_address parameter
should be/point to/resolve to the kolla_external_vip_address.

Closes-bug: 1535333

Change-Id: I5bfcefaf7899298455cdade8209c34324aebfecb
'}]
commit_message:
Implement Option for Two VIPs to separate API traffic

To improve security, operators have asked for two VIPs for
their cloud.

VIP 1 is the internal VIP that can reach internal and admin endpoints.
In addition, the internal VIP can also reach other internal services,
such as the database and message services.
VIP 2 is the external VIP that can only reach public endpoints.

With one VIP only, all services are reached at the same address.

To add a second VIP, this patch adds two new configuration parameters.

kolla_external_vip_address: is an IPv4 address to use for created VIP
kolla_external_vip_interface: is the network interface to use for VIP
In this scenario, the first VIP (the internal VIP), is defined by
the original parameters (kolla_internal address and network_interface).

When using two VIPs, the existing kolla_external_address parameter
should be/point to/resolve to the kolla_external_vip_address.

Closes-bug: 1535333

Change-Id: I5bfcefaf7899298455cdade8209c34324aebfecb

subject: Read functional creds from clouds.yaml
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-28 17:20:03.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tempest_lib/cli/base.py'], 'message': 'Read functional creds from clouds.yaml

devstack now writes out a clouds.yaml file which can be consumed to
find the credentials to use for a functional test run. Rather than
having each client write the code for pulling creds out of it
themselves, provide a default method which pulls the credentials out.
The method can still be overridden if the client wants to do something
additional, but there is really no real benefit in being different here.

This should allow us to delete code from several consumers.

Change-Id: Idaaea24795daf74977a133841960287da6fade3e
'}]
commit_message:
Read functional creds from clouds.yaml

devstack now writes out a clouds.yaml file which can be consumed to
find the credentials to use for a functional test run. Rather than
having each client write the code for pulling creds out of it
themselves, provide a default method which pulls the credentials out.
The method can still be overridden if the client wants to do something
additional, but there is really no real benefit in being different here.

This should allow us to delete code from several consumers.

Change-Id: Idaaea24795daf74977a133841960287da6fade3e

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-24 15:02:08.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_resource.py', 'keystone/common/controller.py', 'keystone/resource/controllers.py'], 'message': "Fix/refactor policy check for cascade operations

The current code for policy check in cascade operations is using
@controller.filterprotected to receive the 'cascade' option and make
use of check_protection call, since the former creates the prep_info
dict, which is needed in the latter's call.

Several issues are involved in this code:
  1) prep_info is being created only for the root of the tree, when it
     needs to be recreated for every subproject, and then passed to
     their respective check_protection calls;
  2) Credentials are not being created for every project;
  3) @controller.filterprotected is only intended to annotate list
     calls.

1) is solved by recreating prep_info for every subproject; 2) is solved
by creating credentials info for every scope (subproject); while 3 is
solved by a refactoring where all the logic for policy enforcement in
cascade calls is put in a new annotation: @controller.cascadeprotected

Change-Id: I5ee5462922a4999c2c61d20c153734c208cfdef1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix/refactor policy check for cascade operations

The current code for policy check in cascade operations is using
@controller.filterprotected to receive the 'cascade' option and make
use of check_protection call, since the former creates the prep_info
dict, which is needed in the latter's call.

Several issues are involved in this code:
  1) prep_info is being created only for the root of the tree, when it
     needs to be recreated for every subproject, and then passed to
     their respective check_protection calls;
  2) Credentials are not being created for every project;
  3) @controller.filterprotected is only intended to annotate list
     calls.

1) is solved by recreating prep_info for every subproject; 2) is solved
by creating credentials info for every scope (subproject); while 3 is
solved by a refactoring where all the logic for policy enforcement in
cascade calls is put in a new annotation: @controller.cascadeprotected

Change-Id: I5ee5462922a4999c2c61d20c153734c208cfdef1

commit_message:
Add update_access() interface to Quobyte driver

Implements the new driver interface for using update_access().

This is a new change set based on a previous one which was abandoned
due to merge issues (see change #275058). This updated change
contains all fixes and additions based on the previous comments.

Implements: blueprint update-access-quobyte

Change-Id: Id25103f9ef56383491dea6b914abdd89783671ef

commit_message:
BGP Dynamic Routing: introduce BgpDrScheduler model

This patch implements a new extension called "bgp_dragentscheduler" which
does instant & auto scheuling of BgpSpeakers to an active BgpDrAgent. In
addition to this the patch also implements the basic CRUD requirement for
binding BgpSpeakers and BgpDrAgent.

BgpSpeaker to BgpDrAgent association can be 1-to-n. An admin user can only
associate/disassociate BgpSpeaker to/from a BgpDRAgent. Default scheduler
class will only assign non-scheduled BgpSpeaker to an active BgpDrAgent.

Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Tidwell <ryan.tidwell@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jaume Devesa <devvesa@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id305d9a583116e155441ac5979bf3f6aa6a8258b

commit_message:
Add processing of user defined VIPs by VIP assigning procedure

This patch implements processing of user supplied VIPs (already assigned).
User defined VIPs are returned w/o any additional checks.

More details can be found in attached blueprint.

Change-Id: I3051c0d6c31e6cf58fb3c6893b2c768292de4787
Blueprint: allow-any-vip

subject: allow **kwargs in identity.v3.token_client:V3TokenClient.auth()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 17:55:02.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/services/identity/v3/token_client.py'], 'message': 'allow **kwargs in identity.v3.token_client:V3TokenClient.auth()

Since auth() does not allow **kwargs, all the methods that call
get_token() have to explicitly pass all the arguments as keyword
arguments. This cause each test in tempest to have to explicitly
pass each variable from the credentials. If **kwargs are allowed
then all the tempest.conf options can be passed as **kwargs to
get_token() making the tests much easier to understand and it
easier to get a token.

Change-Id: I74cd2fc669340d056a877f997cd74d95465494f5
'}]
commit_message:
allow **kwargs in identity.v3.token_client:V3TokenClient.auth()

Since auth() does not allow **kwargs, all the methods that call
get_token() have to explicitly pass all the arguments as keyword
arguments. This cause each test in tempest to have to explicitly
pass each variable from the credentials. If **kwargs are allowed
then all the tempest.conf options can be passed as **kwargs to
get_token() making the tests much easier to understand and it
easier to get a token.

Change-Id: I74cd2fc669340d056a877f997cd74d95465494f5

commit_message:
SELinux support in 9.0 Fuel

This commit removes boot with disabled SELinux because since 9.0 Fuel
is perfect works in permissive mode. Also, it contains some cleanups
after separate project from the Fuel-main repo.

Change-Id: Ieb9cffa2ea2ba5507b86e298b471e43419ca0e4f
Closes-Bug: #1521154

commit_message:
Migrate tempest-lib code into new lib dir

This commit migrates all of the code from tempest-lib as of it's
current HEAD, 6ad0ce42c2791a28125d38b40e7dcddf32dbeed7. The only
changes made to the tempest-lib code is to update the imports and
other references to tempest_lib. Since in it's new home it should
be tempest.lib.

Partially implements bp tempest-lib-reintegration

Change-Id: Iadc1b61953a86fa9de34e285a0bb083b1ba06fa8

typically only one OSD for a devstack deployment, it makes the Ceph

"}]
commit_message:
Ensure single ceph osd is weighted correctly

This patch ensures the OSD has a weight greater than 0 after deployment.
Ceph will not place data on an unweighted OSD and since there is
typically only one OSD for a devstack deployment, it makes the Ceph
cluster unusable.

As for why this behaviour changed recently, I don't have an answer.  But
generally ensuring a reasonable OSD weight is something we should be
doing anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1475333
Change-Id: Ied44ed81d890d25c43e563e844479924ac5f4a04

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-24 05:20:16.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/notify/_impl_log.py'], 'message': "Use more efficient mask_dict_password to mask password

The mask_dict_password method is added from oslo_utils 3.4.0, and it's
about five times faster than the mask_password method, so it's better

Change-Id: I6629ed1232f2e6f1c72b9f13b361e2f9e14b50a4

commit_message:
Use more efficient mask_dict_password to mask password

The mask_dict_password method is added from oslo_utils 3.4.0, and it's
about five times faster than the mask_password method, so it's better
to use mask_dict_password instead of mask_password.

Change-Id: I6629ed1232f2e6f1c72b9f13b361e2f9e14b50a4

commit_message:
Set correct options path for bind9 agent

When using Red Hat systems and bind9 backend,
/etc/named/options.conf should be used so
this patch implements this change  to accomodate
the parameters used in the dns module.

Closes-Bug: #1534309

commit_message:
Don't useless fetch resources on update

Currently when updating resource in the database, we fetch the row many
times uselessly. This adds and uses an API to do less queries.

Change-Id: Ic50f8646fba6a578634e4e869ab5155756b0a1aa

subject: Simplify event count by stack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-15 08:57:23.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Simplify event count by stack

The previous event count by stack used default sqlalchemy ORM count
method, which works fine but uses a subquery and loads all columns. We
can simplify it by using the func.count utility.

Change-Id: Ib3da569022cd4e13d0c7b13d98a4eb766cdb1a61
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify event count by stack

The previous event count by stack used default sqlalchemy ORM count
method, which works fine but uses a subquery and loads all columns. We
can simplify it by using the func.count utility.

Change-Id: Ib3da569022cd4e13d0c7b13d98a4eb766cdb1a61

Decided against this since it means that the isolation
of a test isn't up to the test itself but rather on
every other test that has ever been run cleaning
up after itself.  With the partitioning, as long

be isolated from all the others.

Change-Id: Iaa5c77540abfc0804787316e7e13725c4114cf8a
"}]
commit_message:
Revert isolation part of tests

Decided against this since it means that the isolation
of a test isn't up to the test itself but rather on
every other test that has ever been run cleaning
up after itself.  With the partitioning, as long
as we can come up with a unique ID, the test can
be isolated from all the others.

Change-Id: Iaa5c77540abfc0804787316e7e13725c4114cf8a

subject: Expose bug in cascade policy enforcement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 17:06:03.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_resource.py'], 'message': "Expose bug in cascade policy enforcement

Currently, in order to enforce policy in a project's subtree, it is
checked if the user has access to the whole subtree and if the policy
check passes by changing the scope for the policy check.

However, when changing the scope, the roles taken for the check should
also change accordingly.

This causes a bug where a user has enough permission to update/delete
on the root can cascade that operation to its subtree, even if it
should not be allowed with the actual roles assigned in the subtree.

This patch exposes the bug for both update and delete cascade
operations.

Change-Id: Ica1b891514fb291bd678ae2c49765828646563eb
"}]
commit_message:
Expose bug in cascade policy enforcement

Currently, in order to enforce policy in a project's subtree, it is
checked if the user has access to the whole subtree and if the policy
check passes by changing the scope for the policy check.

However, when changing the scope, the roles taken for the check should
also change accordingly.

This causes a bug where a user has enough permission to update/delete
on the root can cascade that operation to its subtree, even if it
should not be allowed with the actual roles assigned in the subtree.

This patch exposes the bug for both update and delete cascade
operations.

Change-Id: Ica1b891514fb291bd678ae2c49765828646563eb

commit_message:
Fix service-list filter

Currently cinder service list --host=<hostname> will not show any
results for the volume services. This is because the volume-services
append an internal pool name to the hostname and as a result there
won't be a match for the specific filter. This patch fixes the
incorrect work of service-list with '--host' argument. Also it filters
data on the DB side to improve performance.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: 1530144
Change-Id: I21775106693176ca128dbfd9db0d43cfc58de00a
Depends-On: I4044ab15078ecf54447e1c6e67c27fc8d7c9d6f7

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-15 09:46:15.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run
py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this
problem to happen.

"Closes-Bug: #1533919"
Change-Id: Ib247b4000d9c1d906ef55fa2b5cc990cf1120850
'}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run
py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this
problem to happen.

"Closes-Bug: #1533919"
Change-Id: Ib247b4000d9c1d906ef55fa2b5cc990cf1120850

We don't have strong ordering of events enforced, so there is no need to
test that events arrive in order, and it actually make tests fail

Closes-Bug: #1549264

commit_message:
Make ZaqarEventSinkTest more lenient

We don't have strong ordering of events enforced, so there is no need to
test that events arrive in order, and it actually make tests fail
intermittently. Let's relax that check.

Change-Id: I73be763df5ddf863e29df1b9ac8792f05700e006
Closes-Bug: #1549264

subject: Increase the default max_overflow value
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-02-24 11:49:51.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/increase-default-max-overflow-0af787268807f926.yaml', 'oslo_db/options.py'], 'message': 'Increase the default max_overflow value

It turned out that distribution of WSGI requests between forks is not
even when eventlet is used, which can cause pool timeout issues under
load, while there are idle workers with open DB connections, which
should have served these HTTP requests.

The default max_overflow value should be increased to allow DB oriented
services (mostly APIs) handle spikes in number of concurrent requests
trying to use a DB.

At the same time, the default number of greenlets is decreased:

 I65b40b9906b75146a0085bbe168f1e6bcae82f21

which effectively causes a particular worker to stop accepting new
requests it has no resources (DB connections) to handle and allow
other forks accept()'ing on the same FD to proceed.

Testing was performed using this script:

  https://gist.github.com/zzzeek/c69138fd0d0b3e553a1f

With 100 greenthreads in the pool, 50 DB connections allowed overflow
no pool timeout issues were seen with up to 500 concurrent requests
done by ab, while current default values (1000/10) could not handle
even 100 concurrent requests.

See this ML thread for details:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/082717.html

DocImpact

This change potentially increases the number of connections open to the
RDBMS server. If you start seeing "too many connections" errors, please
check these settings and adjust them appropriately:

https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_max_connections
http://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/runtime-config-connection.html#GUC-MAX-CONNECTIONS

Closes-Bug: #1535375

Change-Id: I2e9c2a71d8231e0dfbefc6293ad319e1e459beec
'}]
commit_message:
Increase the default max_overflow value

It turned out that distribution of WSGI requests between forks is not
even when eventlet is used, which can cause pool timeout issues under
load, while there are idle workers with open DB connections, which
should have served these HTTP requests.

The default max_overflow value should be increased to allow DB oriented
services (mostly APIs) handle spikes in number of concurrent requests
trying to use a DB.

At the same time, the default number of greenlets is decreased:

 I65b40b9906b75146a0085bbe168f1e6bcae82f21

which effectively causes a particular worker to stop accepting new
requests it has no resources (DB connections) to handle and allow
other forks accept()'ing on the same FD to proceed.

Testing was performed using this script:

  https://gist.github.com/zzzeek/c69138fd0d0b3e553a1f

With 100 greenthreads in the pool, 50 DB connections allowed overflow
no pool timeout issues were seen with up to 500 concurrent requests
done by ab, while current default values (1000/10) could not handle
even 100 concurrent requests.

See this ML thread for details:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/082717.html

DocImpact

This change potentially increases the number of connections open to the
RDBMS server. If you start seeing "too many connections" errors, please
check these settings and adjust them appropriately:

https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/server-system-variables.html#sysvar_max_connections
http://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/runtime-config-connection.html#GUC-MAX-CONNECTIONS

Closes-Bug: #1535375

Change-Id: I2e9c2a71d8231e0dfbefc6293ad319e1e459beec

commit_message:
Fix conductor to *really* pass the Spec obj

So, we missed the fact that we were blocking the conductor API to pass
the RequestSpec object down to the wire because we arbitrarely set
the argument to None anyway.

commit_message:
Improve status table CSS.

This adds several small improvements to the CSS for the status table
on the homepage. The table itself is now seamlessly enclosed in the
outer panel, and the bar chart column is now capped at 300px with
empty space to the side removed. Additionally, the chart is hidden
on small and extra-small layouts to prevent the table from overflowing
when there isn't enough space for it to fit.

Change-Id: Id17419e381d3a4e18caf10c4a2c96ad152c28963

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-02-22 17:55:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-docs/index.rst', 'doc/source/developer-docs/additional-roles.rst'], 'message': 'Documentation for adding roles to OSA

Potential contributors, particularly those coming from other parts
of the OpenStack community, have asked for guidance on how to add a
role to OpenStack-Ansible for a particular service which is not
currently represented. They may or may not be aquainted with Ansible
already. This guide is not intended to teach them how to work with
Ansible but rather to supplement the general Ansible documentation
and provide guidance on what to do with Ansible to build a role for
OpenStack-Ansible.

Closes-Bug: #1535915
Change-Id: I4d03885ad2a91eb3c626ca444afdbadddef7cf31
'}]
commit_message:
Documentation for adding roles to OSA

Potential contributors, particularly those coming from other parts
of the OpenStack community, have asked for guidance on how to add a
role to OpenStack-Ansible for a particular service which is not
currently represented. They may or may not be aquainted with Ansible
already. This guide is not intended to teach them how to work with
Ansible but rather to supplement the general Ansible documentation
and provide guidance on what to do with Ansible to build a role for
OpenStack-Ansible.

Closes-Bug: #1535915
Change-Id: I4d03885ad2a91eb3c626ca444afdbadddef7cf31

commit_message:
only sync the necessary directories in repo-mirror-sync

This commit switches the rsync method to only include the necessary
directories to be synced, and thereby excludes all additional
directories not needed by kilo, and speeds up the clone of the
upstream repo mirror (by default rpc-repo.rackspace.com).

Change-Id: I199f5ca876ae2f57ee2f6b3474f476f74829efee
Closes-Bug: #1544035

commit_message:
Make MySQL ignore lost+found directory in its datadir

This commit uses the correct way to provide configuration values to
ignore directory names. To specify more than one name, the option
'ignore-db-dir' should be used multiple times, once for each name.

Change-Id: I0264cebcd5ebc5a1c9efe70505d79ca31c271fc9
Closes-Bug: #1484552

commit_message:
Fix doc string in driver interface

Driver docstring incorrectly shows that an active replica
can be expected with the update_replica_state driver
interface.

Fix this by changing the replica_state in the example and
also add a description to clarify possible states.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ia423ddfb53231ef6a71d0f95e48d8e8a93e116fe

commit_message:
[Experiment] Remove exchange info from listeners

I noticed that now we have 15 consumers for notification queues.
Also, I didn't find any usage of exchange info in the code.
So, I decided to try to remove this.
In this change I've deleted as less code as possible. There
are a lot of code to delete if the approach is correct

Change-Id: I9762e582cebebffb47e67beb537d5dffd763c7c4

commit_message:
Proper error message in case LPAR Build Exception

If the LPAR Build fails due to invalid name entry, user should
be notified with the proper error message and there should be
no build re-schedule performed.

Closes-Bug: #1535338

Change-Id: I5e98ca73b1c70bf53d3557c7b1c9f60d8c8e5370

commit_message:
Remove installation of pm-utils

pm-utils was installed on compute nodes because of bug
in libvirt packaging. This should be long fixed and pm-utils
it's self is long dead in upstream. Libvirt dependancy on
pm-utils was removed around April 2014[1].

[1] - http://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=ec70f3696f2eb0012f0cb693dd8c1a569d118240

Change-Id: Ib5f2ee9b4ab58a32fd5f8c4ad514223795bd5225
(cherry picked from commit 2e801bf43e97d974f195e78b84d3b9b68ae12bc1)

Acceptance tests:

Scenario is the same, component install difference only.

Add tests:
*	Deploy cluster with detached keystone, rabbitmq, database and Sahara.
*	Deploy cluster with detached keystone, rabbitmq, database and Murano.
*	Deploy cluster with detached keystone, rabbitmq, database and Ceilometer.

HUGE env (not always pass on deploy):
*	Deploy cluster with 3 controllers, 3 nodes with detached rabbitmq service and 3 nodes with detached db service.
	Note: this test requires at least 11 slaves.

Closes-Bug: #1537784
Change-Id: I243773851d980eee21372965f614d2d4a36388b6
'}]
commit_message:
Deployment with platform components

Acceptance tests:

Scenario is the same, component install difference only.

Add tests:
*	Deploy cluster with detached keystone, rabbitmq, database and Sahara.
*	Deploy cluster with detached keystone, rabbitmq, database and Murano.
*	Deploy cluster with detached keystone, rabbitmq, database and Ceilometer.

HUGE env (not always pass on deploy):
*	Deploy cluster with 3 controllers, 3 nodes with detached rabbitmq service and 3 nodes with detached db service.
	Note: this test requires at least 11 slaves.

Closes-Bug: #1537784
Change-Id: I243773851d980eee21372965f614d2d4a36388b6

commit_message:
The basic function modules of pagination, sort and filter

It covers the basic function modules of pagination, sort and filter.
The basic modules common.py is ported from cinder project.

commit_message:
Fix GRUB_TIMEOUT usage and remove GRUB_HIDDEN_TIMEOUT

This commit removes the GRUB_HIDDEN_TIMEOUT options which shouldn't
be used together with GRUB_TIMEOUT set to a non-zero value. Also, it
fixes the bug and from now the Grub menu will always be shown.

Change-Id: I547ef994c6d239289d12fbdfede0416e766f2710
Closes-Bug: #1540638

subject: Lint YAML files
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-25 15:34:10.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Lint YAML files

Currently most OpenStack code is linted, but YAML files are not.
This patch enables linting in tox tests using the yamllint tool [1].

It also corrects some indentation misalignments and a line longer
than 80 chars; the new CI test will prevent new errors from coming in.

[1]: http://yamllint.readthedocs.org/

Change-Id: Ie33e2636be97a09f27e519be185382be82fa19f2
'}]
commit_message:
Lint YAML files

Currently most OpenStack code is linted, but YAML files are not.
This patch enables linting in tox tests using the yamllint tool [1].

It also corrects some indentation misalignments and a line longer
than 80 chars; the new CI test will prevent new errors from coming in.

[1]: http://yamllint.readthedocs.org/

Change-Id: Ie33e2636be97a09f27e519be185382be82fa19f2

commit_message:
Change SERVICE_TENANT_NAME to SERVICE_PROJECT_NAME

Devstack is converting from TENANT to PROJECT[1]. This patch changes
SERVICE_TENANT_NAME to SERVICE_PROJECT_NAME in the devstack plugin to
match.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281779/

Change-Id: I8761d7c2b1e2bb2d17b275d5e49a0f219242f357
Closes-Bug: #1548634

commit_message:
Mark shared property in Firewall unsupported

Currently shared property is removed from neutron
firewall resource, so need to mark property shared
and attribute shared from heat resource plugin unsupported.
This change is due to [1] and [2].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1465440
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/194652/

Change-Id: Id471640b874031c19b6259e0ab2e185b374318f0
Closes-bug: #1537677

commit_message:
[WIP] [DO NOT MERGE] testing review 278343

By default, the gate does not do a repo-clone-mirror, but instead does
a repo-build every time.

In order to test review 278343, this review changes run-playbooks.sh to
do a repo-clone-mirror instead. This review should not be merged, but
will be deleted if/when review 278343 is accepted.

Change-Id: I59b17bb26cbe76544bd4509414dac18fbaf188af

commit_message:
Use instanceof instead of type

Adjusted conditional statements to use instanceof when
comparing variables. Instanceof supports inheritance type
checking better than type.

Change-Id: I873ef7d5e283ee70f1548f040f1c1d9a675c7159
Closes-Bug: 1548974

commit_message:
Add an empty line separator to the shotgun2 report

Sometimes is hard to read shotgun2 report, especially when one of
the packages doesn't contain the changelog. This commit adds an
empty line separator in the report output.

Change-Id: I504dcfffed0f88c57aa9f1956abd173eb39d7262
Closes-Bug: #1548541

subject: Pin wheel version in repo_server role
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-23 16:20:11.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/repo_server/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Pin wheel version in repo_server role

Currently, wheel 0.29.0 is being pulled in and this is building some
wheels that cannot be installed.  For example,
cffi-1.5.2-cp27-cp27mu-linux_x86_64.whl is being built but pip will
not install this.  Previously, when using 0.26.0, we were building
cffi-1.5.2-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl.

After chatting in #pypa, it was recommended to either downgrade wheel,
or upgrade pip >= 8.

Change-Id: Ic7a9d9992a88fcd93bd7c19fb7f5c907a7299b07
Closes-Bug: #1545505
'}]
commit_message:
Pin wheel version in repo_server role

Currently, wheel 0.29.0 is being pulled in and this is building some
wheels that cannot be installed.  For example,
cffi-1.5.2-cp27-cp27mu-linux_x86_64.whl is being built but pip will
not install this.  Previously, when using 0.26.0, we were building
cffi-1.5.2-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl.

After chatting in #pypa, it was recommended to either downgrade wheel,
or upgrade pip >= 8.

Change-Id: Ic7a9d9992a88fcd93bd7c19fb7f5c907a7299b07
Closes-Bug: #1545505

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-02-19 19:14:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/targets/test_lio_driver.py', 'cinder/cmd/rtstool.py', 'cinder/volume/targets/lio.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_cmd.py'], 'message': '[LVM] Restore target config during ensure_export

If server crash or reboot happened, LIO target configuration
will be initialized after boot up a server. Currently, Cinder
has a functionality to save LIO target configuration to save
file at several checkpoint.

If LIO target service is configured properly, LIO target
configuration is restored by this service during boot up
a server, but if not, existing in-use volumes would become
inconsistent status after c-vol service starts.

If there is no iSCSI target configuration during
ensure_export, LIO dirver should restore the saved
configuration file to avoid the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1536248
Change-Id: I74d300ba26a08b6f423f5ed3e13495b73cfbbd52
'}]
commit_message:
[LVM] Restore target config during ensure_export

If server crash or reboot happened, LIO target configuration
will be initialized after boot up a server. Currently, Cinder
has a functionality to save LIO target configuration to save
file at several checkpoint.

If LIO target service is configured properly, LIO target
configuration is restored by this service during boot up
a server, but if not, existing in-use volumes would become
inconsistent status after c-vol service starts.

If there is no iSCSI target configuration during
ensure_export, LIO dirver should restore the saved
configuration file to avoid the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1536248
Change-Id: I74d300ba26a08b6f423f5ed3e13495b73cfbbd52

commit_message:
Clarify the types for retry_interval args of wrap_db_retry

The retry_interval and max_retry_interval can be floats, and
inc_retry_interval is a bool.

This change has no functional impact.

time expensive operation. The associators can be replaced by
direct queries which improve the performance by decreasing the
time needed to wait to retrieve the associated classes.

commit_message:
Replace associators with direct queries

Using associators to retrieve different associated classes is a
time expensive operation. The associators can be replaced by
direct queries which improve the performance by decreasing the
time needed to wait to retrieve the associated classes.

Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Change-Id: I779785a02d65ff7e57c1ac41d2de90c7b4b619d7

commit_message:
Adds NVGRE related utils (part 2)

Hyper-V Network Virtualization (HNV) was first introduced in Windows
Hyper-V / Server 2012 and has the purpose of enabling the virtualization
of Layer 2 and Layer 3 networking models. One of the HNV configuration
approches is called NVGRE (Network Virtualization through GRE).

Adds NVGRE related Utils.

Change-Id: Iae51f686736d65fddf01dd76ac136d4dabd00e66
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-nvgre
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-os-win-modules

commit_message:
invert the order of endpoint and bind_service attributes

* endpoint type (admin, internal, public) and service (identitiy, network etc.)
  was switched during refactoring, this patch reverts this unintended switching
* edited bind_service service type from public,internal,admin to 'all'
  for default binding to just one service

commit_message:
invert the order of endpoint and bind_service attributes

* endpoint type (admin, internal, public) and service (identitiy, network etc.)
  was switched during refactoring, this patch reverts this unintended switching
* edited bind_service service type from public,internal,admin to 'all'
  for default binding to just one service

subject: Fix AJAX for jQuery versions prior 1.9.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-23 15:50:12.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/static/muranodashboard/js/environments-in-place.js', 'muranodashboard/static/muranodashboard/js/draggable-components.js'], 'message': 'Fix AJAX for jQuery versions prior 1.9.0

All current versions of dashboard require jQuery with minimal version
1.7.2. Therefore, we cannot use "method" option in ajax call as it was
added in 1.9.0.

This patch replaces option method with option "type" that should
be used in older versions and that works as an alias for "method"
in current versions of jQuery.

Closes-Bug: #1548875
Change-Id: I10c734d02f4aeaa1baba57316b8026928c1f1946
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AJAX for jQuery versions prior 1.9.0

All current versions of dashboard require jQuery with minimal version
1.7.2. Therefore, we cannot use "method" option in ajax call as it was
added in 1.9.0.

This patch replaces option method with option "type" that should
be used in older versions and that works as an alias for "method"
in current versions of jQuery.

Closes-Bug: #1548875
Change-Id: I10c734d02f4aeaa1baba57316b8026928c1f1946

commit_message:
Allows for customization of NetworkDeployment actions

We don't necessarily want the network configuration to be reapplied
with every template update so we add a param to configure on which
action the NetworkDeployment resource should be executed.

Change-Id: I0e86318eb5521e540cc567ce9d77e1060086d48b
Co-Authored-By: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jstransk@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 52d19892c12ff785adc0f914647307c1287c059c)

There is no need to use 0.0.0.0 for binding MySQL daemon,
because it always should work only via network with
'mgmt/database' role. Currently access from other networks
(e.g. 'public') is also prohibited by firewall, so security
is not affected. But the daemon still must be configured

Change-Id: I50a81d8d63cd82d2823a76287283ef28cd46362a
Closes-bug: #1548846

commit_message:
Configure MySQL to listen on mgmt/database network

There is no need to use 0.0.0.0 for binding MySQL daemon,
because it always should work only via network with
'mgmt/database' role. Currently access from other networks
(e.g. 'public') is also prohibited by firewall, so security
is not affected. But the daemon still must be configured
correctly too.

Change-Id: I50a81d8d63cd82d2823a76287283ef28cd46362a

commit_message:
Ensure cobbler log directory exists

We need to be sure that cobbler log directory exists
/var/log/cobbler before creating any subfolders.
This can by done by installing cobbler packages first

Change-Id: I1e0969f898009175c0bc3f0c49d5a5a00a1bcf86
Closes-bug: #1548313
Blueprint: separate-fuel-node-provisioning

commit_message:
Fix openstack-cinder idempotency

This fix will configure cinder-backup service with swift backend.

The resources that were always being executed prior to this change:
- File[create-policy-rc.d]
- Exec[remove-policy-rc.d]

Change-Id: Ifb9c6082fac93f65d50cf949966588187c2441fb
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency

commit_message:
Add ipmitool non-voting test to Ironic

The commit 7ffa1d58ce9fd9e32cdab142a1f12feae38c3097 added support to
configure nodes with ipmitool drivers in DevStack ironic to run with
virtual machines. The main goal of that patch was to allow us to test
the production ipmitool drivers in the gate replacing the *_ssh testing
drivers in the future.

This patch is adding two new non-voting jobs to Ironic: pxe_ipmitool and
agent_ipmitool.

Related-Bug: #1544642
Change-Id: I9af881a06ceb2d9a2133db4cf2dc3ffceb0813ff

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 16:25:59.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_compute.pp'], 'message': 'Makes the iSCSI initiator name unique for compute nodes

commit_message:
Makes the iSCSI initiator name unique for compute nodes

When we utilise images for deployment, the iSCSI initiator name
is not unique, leading to problems with live migration. This
patch simply updates the iSCSI initiator name to a unique ID
randomly generated by iscsi-iname.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1244328

Change-Id: I170e7f45f67fa8ce70436f24807d1ed7808f2c32

subject: Override X-Forwarded-Proto header
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-24 08:49:04.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/loadbalancer.pp'], 'message': 'Override X-Forwarded-Proto header

Right now, the only manipulation done to the X-Forwarded-Proto header
is done if an SSL connection is established. This is not sufficient as
one might be able to erroneously put values through that header.

This patch disables that behaviour by defaulting to plain http if an
SSL connection is not established.

Change-Id: I4bf6def21e21148834c2baa9669190bab8fa95ef
(cherry picked from commit 5f915a88e7c4eec6e6a0341808f0fbc4a4b1a161)
'}]
commit_message:
Override X-Forwarded-Proto header

Right now, the only manipulation done to the X-Forwarded-Proto header
is done if an SSL connection is established. This is not sufficient as
one might be able to erroneously put values through that header.

This patch disables that behaviour by defaulting to plain http if an
SSL connection is not established.

Change-Id: I4bf6def21e21148834c2baa9669190bab8fa95ef
(cherry picked from commit 5f915a88e7c4eec6e6a0341808f0fbc4a4b1a161)

subject: Check local and upstream repo for pip before using pypi
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-23 20:06:35.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml'], 'message': 'Check local and upstream repo for pip before using pypi

This patch adds an extra source to try and use before failing and
reverting to installing using the isolated mode (thereby installing
from pypi).

This should result in the install task succeeding on the first
attempt before the local repo exists, instead of always failing
and falling back to pypi.

Change-Id: I41821afb35c29984bd6372b6628aa3ca8a2a5715
'}]
commit_message:
Check local and upstream repo for pip before using pypi

This patch adds an extra source to try and use before failing and
reverting to installing using the isolated mode (thereby installing
from pypi).

This should result in the install task succeeding on the first
attempt before the local repo exists, instead of always failing
and falling back to pypi.

Change-Id: I41821afb35c29984bd6372b6628aa3ca8a2a5715

We now have fixes for everything except the ones
dependant on unpinning puppet-nova. This updates the
delorean pin to a specific delorean repo which has

If this passes, we can merge it with the dependant
patches, and then set it back to the current-tripleo
symlink once that is moved forward.

Depends-On: I8b6d907fe46579007f33a7e69e7d67e79582426c

commit_message:
Move delorean pin

We now have fixes for everything except the ones
dependant on unpinning puppet-nova. This updates the
delorean pin to a specific delorean repo which has
passed for me locally with both HA and nonHA setups.

If this passes, we can merge it with the dependant
patches, and then set it back to the current-tripleo
symlink once that is moved forward.

Depends-On: I8b6d907fe46579007f33a7e69e7d67e79582426c
Depends-On: Ifb8c23c81c665c2732fa5cd757760668b06a449a

Change-Id: I47b4470070ec42a108a90cbae6250ed279cd257d

subject: Parameter to return audit ids only in revocation list
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-02-22 18:55:46.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/auth/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py'], 'message': "Parameter to return audit ids only in revocation list

The revocation list will only include audit IDs and not token
IDs if ?audit_id_only is on the request. Also, the data won't be
obfuscated since the audit_ids aren't useful for auth. If the clients
(typically auth_token) only request the revocation list with audit IDs
only then the deployer doesn't have to do pki_setup to use the
revocation list.

Closes-Bug: 1317302
Change-Id: I197df21098f545b27163c9456917491561b53abb
"}]
commit_message:
Parameter to return audit ids only in revocation list

The revocation list will only include audit IDs and not token
IDs if ?audit_id_only is on the request. Also, the data won't be
obfuscated since the audit_ids aren't useful for auth. If the clients
(typically auth_token) only request the revocation list with audit IDs
only then the deployer doesn't have to do pki_setup to use the
revocation list.

Closes-Bug: 1317302
Change-Id: I197df21098f545b27163c9456917491561b53abb

commit_message:
Operations on reflected entities

Now it is possible to get/set reflected property value on particular object
(or null for static property).

Also it is possible to invoke instance/static reflected methods.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-16 00:05:05.000000000', 'files': ['network/endpoints/endpoint_map.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml', 'environments/enable-tls.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow vncproxy to work with ssl enabled

Right now our vncproxy settings are hard-coded to http and the
non-ssl port.  This change adds a vncproxy entry to the endpoint
map and uses those values to configure the proxy correctly on
compute nodes.  This is sufficient to get it working in my
environment with ssl enabled.

Change-Id: I9d69b088eef4700959b33c7e0eb44932949d7b71
'}]
commit_message:
Allow vncproxy to work with ssl enabled

Right now our vncproxy settings are hard-coded to http and the
non-ssl port.  This change adds a vncproxy entry to the endpoint
map and uses those values to configure the proxy correctly on
compute nodes.  This is sufficient to get it working in my
environment with ssl enabled.

Change-Id: I9d69b088eef4700959b33c7e0eb44932949d7b71

commit_message:
invert the order of endpoint and bind_service attributes

* endpoint type (admin, internal, public) and service (identitiy, network etc.)
  was switched during refactoring, this patch reverts this unintended switching
* edited bind_service service type from public,internal,admin to 'all'
  for default binding to just one service
* use bind_address method from common

Change-Id: I4f97b659361dabd7fac216305d2aad2f1bb98f51
Depends-On: Iec485deaf415e4187a323435cce2b6bbadfc5d42
Depends-On: Ia5bddfc5e2fd77cd6e9e855c680b079f78fc1c3f

commit_message:
3PAR get host by WWN now handles mixed cases

The 3PAR driver comparison of WWNs will be able to handle
WWNs with upper/lower case differences. For example, the
driver code can now locate a 3PAR host with a WWN of
123abc6789012345 or 123ABD6789012345.

Change-Id: I571713f34ec3737123920acdbf20999baccd90b2
Closes-Bug: 1546453

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 15226, 'name': 'Bharath M', 'email': 'bharath.stacker@gmail.com', 'username': 'bharath'}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-18 06:32:58.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/controller/healthmanager/health_manager.py'], 'message': "Fix amphora failover after health monitor start

The health monitor consists of two daemons: One receives heartbeats
from amphorae and updates the database, the other scans the database
for amphorae that haven't checked in in a while. If the health
monitor is down for a while, all the amphorae will seem stale in
the database once it's started again.

This patch changes the behavior of the health_check such that amphorae
have time to check in after the health monitor start before the
health monitor daemon decides they need to be failed over.

Change-Id: I0599d214c645547b3248f73f6bb3380653de0585
Closes-Bug: 1532623
"}]
commit_message:
Fix amphora failover after health monitor start

The health monitor consists of two daemons: One receives heartbeats
from amphorae and updates the database, the other scans the database
for amphorae that haven't checked in in a while. If the health
monitor is down for a while, all the amphorae will seem stale in
the database once it's started again.

This patch changes the behavior of the health_check such that amphorae
have time to check in after the health monitor start before the
health monitor daemon decides they need to be failed over.

Change-Id: I0599d214c645547b3248f73f6bb3380653de0585
Closes-Bug: 1532623

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-23 19:49:28.000000000', 'files': ['mistral_tempest_tests/tests/api/v2/test_mistral_basic_v2.py', 'mistral/cmd/launch.py'], 'message': "Change for synchronous Mistral actions from CLI

This patch allows the Mistral actions to be run synchronously from
the Mistral CLI.

When a Mistral action is run synchronously using the Mistral CLI
'run-action' command, it does not complete successfully. This is due
to the Mistral API server handling requests on a single thread.

The 'run-action' command performs a REST POST call to the
ActionExecution RestController in the API server. That in turn calls
back into the python-mistralclient which then performs another REST
call back to the appropriate REST controller to actually run the
action requested. That call hangs since the requests are handled on
a single thread because the first POST has not completed yet.
Eventually the RPC call between the engine and the executor servers
times out, and the 'run-action' command fails.

This patch changes the Mistral API server so that requests are
handled in separate threads.

Added a new functional test to the tempest test package to test
synchronous action execution of a mistral action from within
mistral.

Change-Id: I8e06d3ef6aab4b2009a8fff4aa4d1acc118eee3f
Implements: blueprint mistral-mistral-actions
"}]
commit_message:
Change for synchronous Mistral actions from CLI

This patch allows the Mistral actions to be run synchronously from
the Mistral CLI.

When a Mistral action is run synchronously using the Mistral CLI
'run-action' command, it does not complete successfully. This is due
to the Mistral API server handling requests on a single thread.

The 'run-action' command performs a REST POST call to the
ActionExecution RestController in the API server. That in turn calls
back into the python-mistralclient which then performs another REST
call back to the appropriate REST controller to actually run the
action requested. That call hangs since the requests are handled on
a single thread because the first POST has not completed yet.
Eventually the RPC call between the engine and the executor servers
times out, and the 'run-action' command fails.

This patch changes the Mistral API server so that requests are
handled in separate threads.

Added a new functional test to the tempest test package to test
synchronous action execution of a mistral action from within
mistral.

Change-Id: I8e06d3ef6aab4b2009a8fff4aa4d1acc118eee3f
Implements: blueprint mistral-mistral-actions

subject: Fix deleted amphora expiration check
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 15226, 'name': 'Bharath M', 'email': 'bharath.stacker@gmail.com', 'username': 'bharath'}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-18 05:40:25.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/functional/db/test_repositories.py', 'octavia/db/repositories.py'], 'message': 'Fix deleted amphora expiration check

During a normal failover, the housekeeping manager will attempt
to clean up database records having to do with the dead amphora based
on the last health check of said amphora. However, at least some of
the time, the amphora health manager would have already cleaned up
the health record, meaning that the housekeeping manager gets a
None response when it attempts to check the deleted amphora health.
This could lead to a failure in the dead amp cleanup process, possibly
gumming up failover or other tasks along the way.

This commit fixes this check such that if no health record exists
for the deleted amphora, it is assumed the amphora is expired and
all record of it can be deleted from the database.

Change-Id: Icded7127d7817d8c71a5fcb90c95775a2bf5f58c
Closes-Bug: 1544427
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deleted amphora expiration check

During a normal failover, the housekeeping manager will attempt
to clean up database records having to do with the dead amphora based
on the last health check of said amphora. However, at least some of
the time, the amphora health manager would have already cleaned up
the health record, meaning that the housekeeping manager gets a
None response when it attempts to check the deleted amphora health.
This could lead to a failure in the dead amp cleanup process, possibly
gumming up failover or other tasks along the way.

This commit fixes this check such that if no health record exists
for the deleted amphora, it is assumed the amphora is expired and
all record of it can be deleted from the database.

Change-Id: Icded7127d7817d8c71a5fcb90c95775a2bf5f58c
Closes-Bug: 1544427

commit_message:
invert the order of endpoint and bind_service attributes

* endpoint type (admin, internal, public) and service (identitiy, network etc.)
  was switched during refactoring, this patch reverts this unintended switching
* edited bind_service service type from public,internal,admin to 'all'
  for default binding to just one service

Change-Id: I9bf230ba53d23ce11a32acaea2410572eaeb6123
Depends-On: Iec485deaf415e4187a323435cce2b6bbadfc5d42

When an update fails on a template resource, we still store the template
in the stack environment. Retrying the update will fail because of
missing parameters, but we can ignore those as they should be harmless
and only matter in this broken case.

Change-Id: I859ea72b1cc95162b6f498b6af65e4d9fdd9458f
Closes-Bug: #1543685
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore errors on old properties during update

When an update fails on a template resource, we still store the template
in the stack environment. Retrying the update will fail because of
missing parameters, but we can ignore those as they should be harmless
and only matter in this broken case.

Change-Id: I859ea72b1cc95162b6f498b6af65e4d9fdd9458f
Closes-Bug: #1543685

commit_message:
Add a request timeout to the REST API driver

The amphora REST driver does not have reasonable timeouts on the
python "requests" library calls. For example, the PUT call to
load a certificate into an amphora can hang forever.
This patch adds a request timeout that defaults to 5 seconds.

Change-Id: I75bed9fa1d590ce206aa0947d35552fc80907c0a
Closes-Bug: #1496634

commit_message:
Fix health monitor URL in API documentation

After looking into bug reports of health monitor URLs not
working after the shared pools patch, I was able to verify that
they do in fact work, but that the legacy documentation was wrong.
(This is after checking both the state of Octavia's documentation
and API code prior to the shared pools patch, and checking the
neutron-lbaas octavia driver in master right now.)

This patch updates the octavia API documentation to list the
correct new and legacy URLs for doing health monitor CRUD operations.

Change-Id: I632a0a50de0320ed316ef0bf180b8d7e788f746a
Closes-Bug: 1543364
Closes-Bug: 1543366

commit_message:
Allocate separate partition for Horizon uploads

By default horizon firstly uploads image to /tmp directory
and pushes it to glance then. Sometimes a lack of free space
in /tmp dir may cause cluster going offline.

Change-Id: I7cb9edd3f6a31b86696d708c525cf8d031642c58
DocImpact: Add information that uploads to Horizon are limited to 11Gb
Partial-Bug: #1496838

subject: Fix scheduler compatibility with Python 3.7 harder
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-11 03:53:09.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Fix scheduler compatibility with Python 3.7 harder

Always catch StopIteration, rather than allowing it to bubble up a level.
This is neccessary due to PEP0479, wherein it was decided that Python will
start converting this exception to a RuntimeError when it bubbles up,
beginning with Python 3.7.

This is a follow-up to f7edd0ba2d3354e57c106e20ad88c50a859db592, which
missed one case of where StopIteration could be raised.

Change-Id: I34bc32e7477bcaa0ddfe30179f1008b1be97c0a3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix scheduler compatibility with Python 3.7 harder

Always catch StopIteration, rather than allowing it to bubble up a level.
This is neccessary due to PEP0479, wherein it was decided that Python will
start converting this exception to a RuntimeError when it bubbles up,
beginning with Python 3.7.

This is a follow-up to f7edd0ba2d3354e57c106e20ad88c50a859db592, which
missed one case of where StopIteration could be raised.

Change-Id: I34bc32e7477bcaa0ddfe30179f1008b1be97c0a3
